title: Tesla, Microsoft, Boeing, Texas Instruments: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Tesla will report earnings after the close; Texas Instruments posted an earnings beat
text:
* The bullish mood was rubbing off on other major technology stocks, including Apple, Meta Platforms and Alphabet, which added around 2% each. Netflix gained 3.4%.

* AT&T shares added 1.5% in the moments after the release of its latest quarterly results.

* Earnings are due from Boeing, Kimberly-Clark and Abbott Laboratories before the open.

* Texas Instruments gained 4% ahead of the bell. The chip maker's fourth-quarter profit and revenue beat Wall Street forecasts.

* Navient shares plunged 12%. The student-loan servicer swung to a fourth-quarter loss as higher expenses combined with lower revenue.

* DraftKings jumped 7.6% premarket. The digital sports-betting company's stock got an upgrade from Morgan Stanley.

* F5 shares fell 14% premarket after the cloud security firm issued guidance below expectations for the current quarter and lowered its annual outlook as supply-chain issues crimp its ability to meet demand.

* Canadian National Railway named a new chief executive officer and made changes to its board Tuesday, moves that will allow the railroad operator to avert a proxy fight. Investors were quiet; the stock was flat premarket.

* Capital One Financial edged down 0.1% after the financial services company said profit fell in the fourth quarter, but beat analysts' consensus projections, as revenue increased due to strong credit results.

* Tesla, Intel, Las Vegas Sands, Duke Realty, Whirlpool are among the companies reporting earnings after the close.

Chart of the Day

* A mania in clean-energy stocks holds lessons for ESG investors, writes James Mackintosh. This is the third in a series of Streetwise columns taking a critical look at sustainable investing.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Tesla, Microsoft, Boeing, Texas Instruments: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
